pull.title: wallet: Correct dir iteration error handling
pull.body:
Make wallet DB properly detect and report failure to scan wallet directory. Seems to have been broken since moving from Boost to std::filesystem.

Found while reviewing: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31410#pullrequestreview-2604068753

verification.payload:
tree 066ad4e9b0ee3ff7abd08fdb8824cc7ad7548a95
parent 5757de4ddd37f9321ee6b338b40888fd3561fc00
author Hodlinator <172445034+hodlinator@users.noreply.github.com> 1749814919 +0200
committer Hodlinator <172445034+hodlinator@users.noreply.github.com> 1749814919 +0200

wallet: Correct dir iteration error handling

Seems to have been broken since conversion from Boost in #20744. The std::filesystem iteration aborts upon failure while Boost might have allowed skipping over faulty entries.

events.message:
wallet: Correct dir iteration error handling

Seems to have been broken since conversion from Boost in #20744. The std::filesystem iteration aborts upon failure while Boost might have allowed skipping over faulty entries.

author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1749563853 +0200

log: Use warning level while scanning wallet dir

events.message: log: Use warning level while scanning wallet dir

rename.from: wallet: Warn upon failing to scan directory
rename.to: wallet: Correct dir iteration error handling

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,6 +78,15 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         self.stop_nodes()
         assert_equal(os.path.isfile(wallet_dir(self.default_wallet_name, self.wallet_data_filename)), True)
 
+        self.log.info("Verify warning is emitted when failing to scan the wallets directory")
+        os.chmod(data_dir('wallets'), 0)
comments.body: I don't think chmod works under root. So this test will likely fail in CI (or other places that use root) and pass locally (or other places that not use root).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,6 +78,15 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         self.stop_nodes()
         assert_equal(os.path.isfile(wallet_dir(self.default_wallet_name, self.wallet_data_filename)), True)
 
+        self.log.info("Verify warning is emitted when failing to scan the wallets directory")
+        os.chmod(data_dir('wallets'), 0)

comments.body:
is this code ever hit? At least corecheck shows it as dead code and according to the docs any error should always lead to the end iterator, which already breaks the loop, no?

https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/filesystem/recursive_directory_iterator.html says: "If the recursive_directory_iterator reports an error [...], it becomes equal to the default-constructed iterator, also known as the end iterator."
when changing the log here, might as well cherry-pick commit fa13b462ed6f5f7f1c5287bad70a443fd0e1f128 for all the other warning logs in this same file?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,6 +78,20 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         self.stop_nodes()
         assert_equal(os.path.isfile(wallet_dir(self.default_wallet_name, self.wallet_data_filename)), True)
 
+        self.log.info("Verify warning is emitted when failing to scan the wallets directory")
+        if platform.system() == 'Windows':
+            self.log.warning('Skipping test involving chmod as Windows does not support it.')
+        elif os.geteuid() == 0:
+            self.log.warning('Skipping test involving chmod as it requires a non-root user.')
+        else:
+            os.chmod(data_dir('wallets'), 0)
+            self.start_node(0)
+            with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(expected_msgs=['Error scanning directory entries under']):
+                _ = self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()
comments.body:
why discard the result. It should be expected to be empty, no?


nit: If you want to take an extra step, it could make sense to pass up the warnings into the result dict as `"warnings": ["...",]`, instead of relying on the debug log
Agreed, replaced block with `assert(!ec)`. Seems to be leftovers from Boost filesystem. Updated PR title/description.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,6 +78,20 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         self.stop_nodes()
         assert_equal(os.path.isfile(wallet_dir(self.default_wallet_name, self.wallet_data_filename)), True)
 
+        self.log.info("Verify warning is emitted when failing to scan the wallets directory")
+        if platform.system() == 'Windows':
+            self.log.warning('Skipping test involving chmod as Windows does not support it.')
+        elif os.geteuid() == 0:
+            self.log.warning('Skipping test involving chmod as it requires a non-root user.')
+        else:
+            os.chmod(data_dir('wallets'), 0)
+            self.start_node(0)
+            with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(expected_msgs=['Error scanning directory entries under']):
+                _ = self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()
comments.body: Added negative case for before we call `chmod`, then added assertion of return values in both cases. Punting on "warnings" for now.
